title: Drawing, "Decoration of Facade of Building Dedicated to Music", 1800–25
medium: Pen and ink over traces of graphite on laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Elevation of three-story building, eight windows in ground and top floors, six windows and two doors in second story. Ground floor: six statues upon pedestals between windows. Lower two floors: decorations of tops of window cases. Second floor: trophy with lyre, railings before door. Top floor: busts in niches between windows of top floor.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Decoration of Facade of Building Dedicated to Music", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and ink over traces of graphite on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3086.
